intro: Batschia caroliniana, commonly known as Carolina false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Batschia caroliniana plays a role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and birds, by providing nectar and habitat.
